Reviews.Title: “HARD TO BEAT !!!”
Reviews.Author: accord24
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here last August for 4 nights . The staff are very friendly and helpfull . The room was comfortable ,quiet and very clean. The locality is tops , so many wonderful places to visit within walking distance , and great resturants abound !!!!!.. The metro is just down the hill and lots of busses at the door. I look forward to a return visit later this year. .

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location and staff”
Reviews.Author: pilotguy13
Reviews.Content: For the experience of Paris, you cant beat this place for the location and price combination! The Latin quarter is where it is and where you want to be. They have free wi-fi, great hot showers with great water pressure, and clean rooms. The front desk staff were ALL super nice to us when we were there. Having 3 person rooms available was a great help too! The beds were a bit firm, but typical. The pillows were great! 5 minute walk to Notre Dame and all the food you can eat. Convenient to all the trains too! We were really happy with how quiet it was. we were on the 4th floor. The floor in our room creaked really bad, so hopefully we didn't disturb others below us. Thats the only concern I had with the place..

Reviews.Title: “Straight out onto Boulevard St Michel”
Reviews.Author: whatsuptigerlily
Reviews.Content: Clean and simple room, right near the latin quarter but nothing too loud or open all night in ear shot. Friendly and efficient staff. My only downer - I just cant stand carpet lifts. They are in most hotels and they make me ill. Otherwise everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “A deal”
Reviews.Author: InandoutNorway
Reviews.Content: Always helpful & friendly front desk. Rooms nice and cleans. Perfect location between Luxembourg Gardens and Pl Saint Michel

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Imissucico
Reviews.Content: Hotel Suez offers a perfect combination of comfort and convenience: it is located directly in the hearth of the latin quartier, within walking distance to Notre Dame, Ile de France, Louvre and many more attractions. The rooms aren't big, but have everything you may need including a great shower! It is of course a bit expensive, but you can't expect to pay much less for a parisian downtown hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful, breakfast is not included but for 5 euro you can have it either in the tiny hall or in your room, without extra-charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality regarding price”
Reviews.Author: Hesham K
Reviews.Content: Nice and cosy small urban hotel. Quite old but impeccably clean and maintained. I've appreciated the smile and availability of the staff which is quite unusual for Paris!! Incredibly well located and near to everything. Breakfast could be ameliorated but you'll find other options in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tallguy_11
Reviews.Content: We were happily surprised when we got to our room. It was a triple and quite large with a good size bathroom. Very Parisian and quite cute. When we stayed it was fairly warm and the room has no aircon so we needed the windows open. There was a bar/cafe right below and the noise went to late in the night. If youre happy to accept this as being a part of Paris you will love the hotel. Staff were helpful and hotel is in an awesome location. Good value for money in Paris. Most rooms would not be over the bar/cafe.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: susanpradja
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 other friends in Aug 2011. The only plus point is the location (pretty close to bus stop and metro station), but other than that, I regret I didn't choose other hotel. The room was small and ugly, though the bathroom was okay and had a separate toilet. The bedcover was not clean, I felt itchy all night. On the night before we left, we just found out that there were many good hotels in Cluny area which were surrounded by cool restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and no hot water for 15 mins after a long day sightseeing!!!”
Reviews.Author: LintyL
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location but unfortunately we found the service and amenities definitely sub par! We booked this hotel due to it's location and the good reviews on here, but I have to say it is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. The staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. One of the staff members pushed in front of my mother when she was waiting for the very puny lift (beware if you are claustrophobic). Tonight we were out late tired from traveling at 6.30am on the eurostar and a full day sightseeing and all I was looking forward to was a warm shower and bed. Only to find the hot water not working. Once we informed reception they said it would take 10-15 mins! Overall not a good experience at all!

Reviews.Title: “Family run and traditional. We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Lupinfairy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, very near to 2 Metro stations. This is a real family run hotel with such a great attitude to their guests. The hotel is old, cute and meticulously clean. The lift fits a tiny couple and a suitcase but this is part of the charm. The breakfasts were good. Beds comfortable. Odd design of shower in our room but a well sealed bathroom floor meant a towel dried it up!! We were a family of 7 who booked 4 rooms and all of us would stay there again when we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing experience in Europe so far..should be at least a 3-star”
Reviews.Author: lupilove04
Reviews.Content: In February, we rented (and paid total amount) an apartment for a 2-week stay in Paris through a vacation rental website in June-July. A week before our trip, the host cancelled our reservation without bothering to give us credible reasons for doing so. The good news: our money was refunded 24 hours later. The bad news..: this left us with no acommodations in Paris and during high season! We had never been to the city but we were determined to find a small but comfortable hotel with good customer reviews in St Germain or the Quartier Latin. We came up with the Hotel de Suez given the excellent reviews here on Tripadvisor..surprisingly, it is not even mentioned as an option in most well-known travel sites. I think it was a true blessing that with such short notice they were not booked. Upon arrival, the front desk staff was very friendly and although we had booked a room with a double bed, given that we were staying 11 nights they offered us an apartment they own across the street. We were amazed that they actually had an apartment to offer since it was our initial plan, and we did not read one was available on their website. We were hesitant at first but for a small difference in the price, we stayed in a beautiful,clean, well-kept apartment directly across the street from the hotel, with hotel service: our towels were changed every day, the trash was taken out, etc. We had a lovely kitchen to ourselves, a fridge and a 4 burner stove top with an oven, microwave, and totaly equipped with everything you can imagine. I have stayed in resorts that are not as well equipped. You could even see a bit of the Eiffel Tower from the windows. The elevator is basic as are most in Europe: 2 adults will fit with little or no luggage but this is fine with us. The apartment is actually a 1 BR unit with a large closet, safety box, and wonderful bathroom (the shower space is a bit small though...but once again, this was not a problem for us). There's a large selection of Paris and France travel books in the living room, a stereo, small flat-screen tv (which we only turned on once!) and everything was tastefully decorated. We had free internet in the room. Two blocks away there's a 3-story Monoprix (not the one across the street), and only once you walk in you realize that the "basement" is actually a big supermarket. We enjoyed buying French wine and food and prepared a few dinners and breakfast everyday in our kitchen. One of the advantages of the area is that you have every dining option you can imagine everywhere. I would recommend walking behind the Mc Donald's near the RER station down the street and you will find 2-3 small streets with a great variety of restaurants displaying their menus...they are open untill late at night as this part of the city (St Germain/Latin Quartier) has mainly a younger crowd. As I mentioned, the metro line 4 and RER B and C stations are 1-2 blocks away and we took this to the airport and saved over 20 EUR compared to the shuttle service that we paid for when we arrived. The metro may no be the cleanest...but it is very safe and reliable and it is very easy to transfer to the other metro and RER lines. We took the RER to Versailles and walked 1 block to buy tickets and took our time there as well (opposed to a guided tour...you spend as much time as you want and save a bunch). The hotel is 2 blocks from Notre Dame and a rough 6 blocks from the Louvre. In summary, we can't say enough about the Hotel de Suez. Staff is superb and always had great advice on everything. They give you maps, directions and are just wonderful. I cannot think of anywhere else I'd rather stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer201107
Reviews.Content: We reviewed so many hotels in Paris and decided this one would be the best for location and cost. We were right! It was clean and comfortable and the employees were very nice! The elevator is small, but you can get up and down with your suitcase, and i loved the old world charm of it. Breakfast was great too and very filling. I especially loved being able to step out on St.Michel and be withing walking distance to all ths sights. This was truly my favourite hotel during my stay in France. Thank you so much and I am definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value, but...”
Reviews.Author: Idaho2Reepie
Reviews.Content: This was a great location and a good value, but I was not pleased with some things. The phones shorted out, there was no lighting at the end of our hall, windows stuck, and mostly, the cleaning solution, (I think it was that) had such an incredibly pungent oder that it was overpowering. The oder made the hotel experience really unpleasant. The beds were like rocks. The elevator holds 2 small people max, or one and their suitcase and stops short of top floor. I felt it was a bit tacky. I would explore getting a comperable value at one of the many other hotels located close by. I would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ClaudioGoldman
Reviews.Content: I was at Hotel the Suez with my wife for 4 nights in june 2011. Location is great, you just walk a little through nice neighbourhood and you are at River Seine, Notre Dame, Marais... Jardin de Luxembourg is right next. Our room was nice and clean. Bathroom is nice, hot water all day (I just would recommend they put the shower higher, a taller person would have problems to use it). We were just above a bar at back street, not a problem (I think french bars are a lot less noising then brazilian ones... at least from monday to thursday). Staff is friendly, breakfast is simple and nice (nice croissants, orange juice, coffee and milk, thanks to Colombo and Paul !) (no eggs and bacon). We will definitely be back with our daughters.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Londoner1987
Reviews.Content: A basic but comfortable hotel but with an enviable location and brilliant service. I was In Paris for a conference in a very very expensive hotel and last minute my boyfriend decided to join me in Paris to do some sightseeing and eat some delicious food for a couple of nights. We found it difficult to find a hotel last minute and when he booked a 2star place, I was a little concerned. However, I was amazed by the location, we love the Latin quarter and this is 5mins walk from Notre Dame and a stones throw from the bars and cafes of St Germain. The hotel was clean, rooms a decent size and with free wifi. The service was great. The continental breakfast can be bought to your room for no extra charge and the clerk was patient enough to entertain my pidgin French interspersed with English. The best thing was that after worrying about having lost my Blackberry, I arrived back in London to find the staff had found it in the room and placed it in a sealed envelope in the bag I had left with them temporarily. A huge relief!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel right in the middle of Paris! Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: crazyleslie
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable room with two large beds and a ton of cozy down pillows and extra blankets! Large clean bathroom, TV, FREE wi-fi Internet, aNd for an extra small fee they deliver delicious coffee and croissant breakfast. People were so nice and helpful and spoke English. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in non-multinational chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: hegzo
Reviews.Content: - Very good location. - Extremely tight escalator (Max 2 persons without any bags). - One of the Staff at the reception was very impolite and unfriendly. I had to leave the hotel after the 2nd night. - They did not have a babycot nor there was space in the room for one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kirkabee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend for 3 nights recently and was very impressed. The location of the hotel is excellent for seeing Paris we thought being just near to both metro and RER stops and near to a lot of restarants/bars/cafes. It also walkable distance to things like Notre Dame cathedral and the Louvre if you dont want to go on public transport. The staff were really friendly and helpful and it being 24 hrs reception is useful, esp not having to worry about taking your key everywhere. The room was large enough with plenty of storage space which can be lacking in hotel rooms I find. The bathroom was large and bright thanks to sky light above it with shelves in it whcih were nice so things didn't get damp on the floor. Although a previous review mention problems wiht the housekeeping we didnt have an issue at all. The room and ensuite was always very clean when we came back at the of the day and towels been replaced etc. The breakfasts were pleasant and filling, excellent hot chocolate as well, this can be served in the room for free. The best feature of the room for us was the little balcony overlooking the roofs and street below which meant that could get some fresh air into the room and also see out. We also had a small table with seats which was nice. The only small criticism id have (and it is a bit picky) is that there are signs saying that drinks are available in reception but none were when we there. However there is a small supermarket just next door which has snacks and drinks both alcoholic and non-alcoholic, dont forget the bottle opener though!! As an aside Id definitely recommend getting the Batobus from just next to Notre Dame as a wonderful way of getting up the Seine, especially the last cruise of the night at 9.30pm as everything is all lit up and looks beautiful. Goes all the way up to Eiffel tower and your ticket lasts all day as a hop on-off tour. Overall id say the hotel is a great base for a stay in Paris and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de Suez has slipped a bit in the housekeeping department.”
Reviews.Author: WriterTraveler
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the people are helpful, but the grout in the shower and floor was moldy. We asked to have the maid clean it, but we were told it wasn't the maid's job!?? Okay, whose job is it?? If I had a bottle of bleach and water I would have cleaned it! Our family has stayed at the Suez for many years so this was a bit of a disappointment in Room 502 during our one week stay. We were traveling with family members whose room faced Rue Champollion in the back of the hotel. It was quite noisy with the students milling around until the early morning hours. Too bad there are not shutters on those windows to help muffle the sound. My husband and I always stay facing Boulevard Saint Michel and closed our shuttles to help with some of the sound. I see they have lowered their breakfast prices somewhat but the room prices are more. With the exchange rate now almost $1.42 to the euro, it may be a long time before we'll be back at that rate, although Paris and France are some of our favorite places. Switzerland is the other.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: magnusar
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Suez provided the base for our weekend break in Paris. Its location is simply the best! The staff were friendly and the service is reliable. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: owl2
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 days in Paris with my mum, staying at the Hotel de Suez, and we can highly recommend this hotel. On arrival, a porter took our bags up to our room for us, which was much appreciated. We had paid for a smaller twin room, but were actually given a large room for 3 people (408). Our room faced the back, overlooking a narrow street. Other reviewers have commented on noise levels, and because of this we were a little apprehensive, but although there was a little noise in the evening, (as would be expected from being right in the centre of a vibrant capital city), it was absolutely nothing that disturbed us or stopped us from sleeping at all. The beds were comfy, with lovely crisp linen. Lighting was extremely good in the room, and also in the bathroom. The hairdryer in the bathroom was really good, unlike some hotel dryers, and there was an excellent extendable magnifying mirror, which was probably meant for shavers, but was great for applying make up. The bathroom was clean, shower large, with high-pressured hot water, and each person gets a bath towel and a smaller hand / hair towel. Another VERY small detail was that the toothbrush cups were glass not plastic, so they didn't fall over with the weight of your brush (never nice when your brush falls into the sink or on the floor and you're not sure if it's clean or not). There was lots of shelf, surface and wardrobe/cupboard space in the bedroom and bathroom for storage. There was no noise from other rooms. We arrived on a hot day and a fan had been put in the room, although we didn't use it as the room was fine and we slept with the window open. CNN is shown on the TV (channel 9). The breakfast area is small and kind of in the lobby, however you can request that your breakfast is brought up to your room. This is offered at no extra charge, and can be ordered day to day. We often ordered it late in the evening when we came in, which was no problem. It cost 5.95 euros per person, and was excellent value. It comprised a roll and croissant, a glass of orange juice, butter and jam, and a choice of coffee, tea or hot chocolate. We had coffee and hot chocolate, and you are given a pot, not just one cup. Both pots gave just under 3 large cups. Yes you could go to a boulangerie elsewhere, but you would pay much more for the amount that we got. We received a warm welcome and excellent service from all staff every time we entered or left the hotel, and the reception staff do speak good English. The lift is very small, but you could fit 3 slim people in, albeit rather squashed! The stairs are fine, anyway. When checking out, there's also no problem leaving your bags to pick up later on. Location-wise, it couldn't have been more perfect for us. It's so easy to get to from Charles de Gaulle. Just take RER line B, get off at St Michel and walk 2 mins up the street. Notre-Dame and the Seine are about 5 mins walk away, there are lots of restaurants nearby, there's a supermarket over the road, there are 2 Starbucks about a minute away, (if for some strange reason you don't want to go to one of Paris' fantastic cafe's). If you like steak and chips, you have to go to "Le Depart" at the bottom of Bld St Michel - the steak is really good, and the cafe is very French! I really can't think of anything negative to say about this hotel. For the price, I wouldn't consider anywhere alse, and I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: janice1310
Reviews.Content: We strongly recommend this hotel, (run by the same family for the past 28 years), especially if travellers are interested in staying near the Latin Quarter and the heart of Paris. We were able to walk back to our hotel late at night ,which we very much valued after our experience last year, when we stayed outside the metro ring and had to catch a bus and a taxi home, as the Metro closes at midnight in Paris. For dining, we liked very much the enormous range and choice of menu and price that the Latin Quarter offered, 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel. For shopping, the St. Michel Boulevarde where the hotel is located, met all our needs. All the staff in the hotel were great - multi-lingual, helpful and friendly, which we always like. The room was large, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The only negative was that we had to pay for the internet, which was a pity, but who's complaining when everything else was great!

Reviews.Title: “Brillant Place”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good value hotel and got much more in booking hotel suez. Room was on 3rd floor but there was a lift which has to be the smallest lift in the world but it did the job.Staff very helpful and poliet. And the room was a lot bigger than i thought reading some comments on hotels in paris . Spotless clean bathroom and pleanty of hot water,a very comfortable bed and great nice sleep was got. What can i say about location fantastic near metro and rer, loads of resaurants with great valu menu also plenty of shops and also next door to hotel a supermarketNear NOTRE DAME LA SORBONNE and fantastic garden JARDIN DE LUXEMBOURG. I will be back to paris again loved the city and wouldnt be looking for another hotel as hotel de suez ticked all boxs.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel for Paris”
Reviews.Author: pascalis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in very good position. It is near three metro stations and rer. My room was on the four floor in the back of hotel and was very quite. Small hotel but big enough rooms.All the channels in tv was at france, very bad. The room was clean.The staff was very good and helpful. It has enough close - with foot - a lot of things louvre , gardens of luxemburg, pantheon etc.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: dronchi
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the location and it didn't disappoint. It is near two metro stations, there is a small market just next door, and Cafes, restaurants, and attractions are a very short walk away. I arrived in Paris by train in Gare Montparnasse and within twenty minutes I was at my hotel. My room was on the second floor and had a window facing the interior of the hotel. Street noise was minimal and interior noise was adequate, but not great. My room didn't have air conditioning, but there was a fan which was good enough for me. The room was clean, but as other have said it is an older place and it definitely could use an update. Other than that the room was cramped like other European hotel rooms but it had everything that I needed. It even had free WiFi! The staff seemed nice, although my needs are few so I never had to ask for any assistance other than to leave my bags for a few hours after I had checked out. My general impression is that this is the perfect hotel for people who spend their vacation seeing the city and only need a hotel room for a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff couldn't be nicer or more helpful”
Reviews.Author: jgh50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our two teenage sons. All four of us stayed in one room. The hotel staff was wonderful and got us a cot for my younger son and a fan (there was a heatwave on when we visited). They helped us with advice, restaurants, transportation, everything. The accomodations were very roomy and the beds were ok, nothing special but for the price it was worth it. The hotel has a great location, right in the middle of great sites and shopping. However, because the hotel is so central, it can be noisy at night. Since it was so hot when we visited we had the windows open all night it was very noisey. Earplugs would probably have solved the problem but I didnt' think of it until afterwards. The breakfasts were simple (croissant, mini bagette with cafe au lait, oj and water) but delicious and the best deal anywhere. If you are looking for a good value in a central location this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right combination”
Reviews.Author: Bluemoon52
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many Paris hotels before and many in the Latin Quarter/St Germain areas but rarely have I found a hotel with the right combination of price, location, facilities and service as this one. It's a 2 star hotel with the attitude of a 3 star. The welcome was authentically friendly, the room was large by Paris standards as was the bathroom, the price was very comprtitive and the location is just perfect. A few minutes from the Luxembourg Gardens, the Pantheon, the river, Notre Dame and all the bars and the restaurants of St Germain. Throughout our stay, the reception staff were helpful and polite and the whole place was welcoming, clean and clearly well-run. The only downside was that it was a little noisy at night but if you want a hotel on the Boulevard St Michel at this price, then personally I don't think it a big issue.

Reviews.Title: “simple but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: brazilian_tourist
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I stayed in Hotel de Suez. It´s location is simply perfect (walking distance to Notre Dame, Louvre, Jardin de Luxembourg, D´Orsay Museum). The hotel itself is very simple, but for the price you pay, it is quite reasonable for Paris standards. Most rooms need renovation. Front desk staff is very nice and helpful. I do not recommend having breakfast in the hotel. For the price they charge it (7 euros, I believe), you can find very good options nearby (try Paul's, at 14 Boulevard St Michel). There are 2 subway stations very close to the hotel, so you don´t need to get a taxi from the airport (RER trains from Charles de Gaulle stop in one of these stations).

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: theslant
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel, because we were staying on a budget and we read some nice reviews online prior to booking. The room was comfortable enough, clean and nice sized with a decent private bath and shower. The elevator was a bit old and creaky, but it was sufficient for bringing up our luggage. There was a fairly priced pot of coffee which we ordered each morning we stayed and which was brought to our room. The man at the front desk was helpful. We booked a bus tour of the city through the front desk, but it seemed higher priced than other options we might have planned elsewhere or booked sooner. I do recommend taking a bus tour if it is your first trip to Paris. We took a night tour which allowed us to see the beautifully lit Eiffel Tower among other things. From our hotel, we walked most everywhere. There is a train station just down the street from the hotel (St. Michel I believe), and we were able to easily walk from the station to the hotel door, although the door is a little hard to spot. The river Seine is just down the block also. Overall, we were satisfied with our stay and would return if travelling to Paris again on the same budget. This is just about the cheapest, most decent hotel right in the center of Paris, and it didn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, honey! Great location, clean, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: error_911
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Suez for our winter honeymoon, December 29th through January 3rd. The hotel is wonderfully placed in the middle of the Latin quarter, in the 5th district ("arrondissement"). The best cafes are no more than 10 minutes away by foot, as is the Notre Dame cathedral. Also, the Saint-Michel - Notre Dame metro station / train station is about 2 blocks away. The room we had (#302) was very clean, and the sheets/towels were changed daily. We had a double room with separate rooms for the toilet and shower/sink, which were both clean and modern. I have to say though that the room with the toilet was quite small... though by quite small I mean about 3 feet by 3 feet, so be prepared for those in your room to hear your every noise when in the bathroom as closing the door is more than uncomfortable. As I was with my wife this was not an issue whatsoever, and did not at all detract from our stay. The shower was great, good pressure, good hot water. Reading others' reviews we did notice complaints about the noise from the street, and ended up with a street-facing room. We live downtown Montreal and are used to noise, but this was nothing close to loud. With the windows closed all that was audible was the odd police siren or honking car. I tend to be a fairly light sleeper and had no problem whatsoever. Otherwise, the staff was very nice to us, though I'm not sure about their english as we only spoke french. They were very helpful whenever we needed anything (reservations, internet access - which was wireless and free, opinions, etc). Yes the elevator is tiny, but who really cares when the price and location are both great. Its big enough to lug up your suitcase upon arrival and when leaving, otherwise the stairs were fine as the hotel is but 4 floors anyhow. Would recommend to a friend, and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, central in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dutchDenHaag
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel just 1 day ahead by internet. Good service by email and internet, very quick reaction. Just check the right price. The hotel is very easy to reach. From Gare du Nord, just two stops by RER to Saint Michel. At the reception they are very friendly. The room is clean and the bathroom is large. I did not have breakfast, but they told me that they can bring it to your room as well. Next to the hotel you find the monoprix supermarket. In front of the hotel is the busstop. The bus 21 and 27 brings you directly to Printemps and La Fayette. From Metro Saint Michel you can reach other spots very easy. Near the hotel you find a lot of (touristic) restaurant of the Saint Michel area. If you are looking for a nice hotel, you can book de Suez hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of fashionable Quartier Latin!”
Reviews.Author: nikolas_from_greece
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of the Hotel de Suez is undoubtedly its location in the middle of the chic Quartier Latin/St Michel, near Notre Dame, the Seine and the Parc de Luxembourg. The rooms are OK but not to be thrilled with and as always they are considerably overpriced for what they offer (of course we are talking about Paris, buddy...)- it is to be borne in mind that we had booked the larger rooms which are situated in the upper floors and which cost 40-45 Euros more than the regular. They are fairly clean except from the fact that the lady in charge did not change the sheets even once during our 5 day stay, she simply turned them upside down!!!! The breakfast is not included in the price which is a pity, but I would surely recommend it because it is very nice and fresh. The hotel also boasts of the "tiniest" lift of the world, maximum it can take one person!

Reviews.Title: “Best for this price”
Reviews.Author: Nikoloz
Reviews.Content: We visited Hotel de Suez this January. Hotel is very clean, staff is a little beat “cold” but very professional and adequate. Location is great and overall it is very good choice for such price in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - Best Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: druit
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Suez is in the heart of the Latin Quarter of Paris and could not be more centrally located for sightseeing. The metro stop is only 2 blocks away, and Notre Dame and the Louvre. Staff was very friendly and spoke perfect English. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Belle Paris - France”
Reviews.Author: DesAiLike
Reviews.Content: Not sure if you ever heard your real estate agent go - Location, Location, Location! If not, then read on. We grabbed our bags from CDG baggage claim, walked up to the train station & caught RER line B to St. Michel/Notre Dame station (Paris - 40 minutes). Got out on pedestrian exit no. 2 (Cluny/St. Germain) & we were officially in 5th Arrondisement (Latin Quarter). WOW! Our first walk down Paris streets . Headed south on Boulevard St. Michel and in 10 minutes, we were at our hotel (Hotel De Suez). After reading about the size of hotel rooms in Paris, we really did not set very high hopes on what to expect. But, after checking into our room (Room 401), I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised. The window looked out straight onto St. Michel & the bathroom had a bidet. They have a very friendly staff & were very happy to answer all our queries - my wife even got to brush up her French with them. Trust me when I say - they were very patient with her. You can read up my blog with all details of things & places around this location on: http://samirmdesai.spaces.live.com/ Overall, a good hotel with a friendly staff & a Fantastic Location, Location Location! Hope you enjoy reading the rest of my blog.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find for Teenagers!”
Reviews.Author: nab216
Reviews.Content: Last summer (I've been meaning to write this review for quite some time) two friends and I stayed here and had a great experience. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. They realized we were dumb 18-year-old American teens and gave us maps and told of us some younger hang-out spots in the city. It's located in a great area with Notre Dame very close, as well as many shops and cafes. The hotel, in general was clean, and so was our room. We had a great little balcony in our room, overlooking the street. My only complaint would be that it's a little noisy because the street is so busy with traffic and people in the morning and late at night (especially the garbage truck). The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean. The shower pressure was great, unlike some hotels where the water barely trickles out. The elevator was hilarious. It only fits one person at a time so we each had to hug our big suitcases while we rode up to our floor. Overall, it was a great time and I would definitely stay there again! Oh, and the Wi-Fi was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: OK10splayer
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel de Suez. We had a triple room. It was a bit warm at night but we had a room in the back and it was very noisy to open the window -- people talking loudly all hours, homeless man snoring like a freight train, and trash trucks between 5-6am. Otherwise, staff were nice and helpful and we loved staying in the Latin Quarter. There are tons of subway/train stops nearby and lots of things to see just in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good, simple budget hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Trinman80
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel de Suez over the Easter holiday weekend. Were able to get a twin room with 2 beds. Amenities are very simple, no-frills. Private in suite bathroom was functional, decent shower. Decently clean, very friendly front desk staff, great location in the heart of the Latin Quarter. If you're looking for a simple, economical place to stay in Paris, definitely consider this place.

Reviews.Title: “Had a pleasant stay (polish visitors)”
Reviews.Author: wmigda
Reviews.Content: We've spent in de Suez three nights in room 207 (twin bedroom). The room windows overlooked a small street at the rear of the hotel. The mentioned street gets noisy in the morning (trash collecting trucks) and in the evening (loudly conversing youth sitting at the curbs). The room was clean and bright, decently decorated. The en-suite bathroom was very nice and I haven't notice any traces of mold or anything like that. Through all three nights we haven't spotted a mouse at any occassion so at least this room is free from their presence. We didn't order breakfast, so we cannot comment on that, however there's a choice of small local bakeries (boulangeries/pattisieries) where you can buy buns/bread/baguettes for your own breakfast. For our stay we've also ordered a small fridge upon checkin (3 EUR/night) which sufficed to keep some of the produce fresh throughout our stay. The elevator is tiny indeed (as mentioned in some other reviews) but apparently it is restricted mainly for staff's activities like luggage/breakfast, so rather don't bother using it. The staff was friendly and we haven't had any issues with them - I guess being bien eleve pays back. We weren't forces to leave the keys at the desk as well - we were leaving them when we were hitting the town and wanted the staff to come and clean the room. Also, the keys were returned to us whenever we were coming back, however, our identity wasn't checked but we had to specificaly state the room number, so if it bothers you then try finding some other place. Nonetheless, the hotel's location is indeed a major advantage of this place and if we would ever come back to Paris then we'd consider Hotel de Suez again. Cheers,

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at Hotel de Suez!”
Reviews.Author: salsasun
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly service, nice and clean rooms, continental breakfast delivered fast and fresh. One room has a roof patio nice and sunny.

Reviews.Title: “Mouse in room”
Reviews.Author: kqjoened
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Suez for 3 nights and found out our room had came with complimentary acquaintance. After reading good reviews in Tripadvisor and loving the convenient (tourist trap) location, we booked it directly with the hotel. On our first night, Christmas eve, my husband was unable to sleep because he heard noises around the room. We were too jet-lagged so we did not bother to investigate. On the second night, after spending whole day in the City, we noticed there were crumbs on the carpet. We had brought some pastries back to our room and to our disgust; looks like something had been chewing it. Hence we devised a plan, with flashlight on hand we turned off the lights and wait. About 5 minutes in, sure enough we heard noises coming from the direction of our pastry bag. At the other end of our flashlight's ray was a mouse gnawing on our bread! We saw the mouse! It ran scurriedly to a small gap behind the stairs to the bathroom where it disappeared. As if commanded, I packed while husband stormed to front-desk. The night shift front-desk was a middle-aged Srilankan man whose name we had forgotten, reluctantly handed us the key to another room. By the time we arrived at our replacement room, it was 1AM. The next morning we told our stories to the frontdesk team, Eric, who responded that "We are aware of this situation and we are also frustrated with it", while the other lady added that "This has never happen before". You are aware and you still rent out the room anyway? And yet on our checkout, we were charged for the full 3 nights length of stay. What a Christmas blasphemy! We understand that there are vermins in Paris but we do not expect to sleep with one in a hotel room. The hotel claimed that they did not charge the extra rate for the upgraded room. Well in our opinion, they would be crazy if they dare. We wasted few hours in the morning of our vacation trying to find a different hotel. But it was Christmas and most hotels were booked. We forced ourselves to stay one more night. The whole experience was a nightmare. We took some pictures of both rooms that we stayed in and the hole that the mice occupied. In the second room, (the "upgrade room") there were molds in the bathroom and the shower head was missing is holding place. The whole time you have to hold it up, unless you want water splashing everywhere the moldy walls and mirrors. We also took a picture of our pastry bag with bite marks on the corner. Not the kind of place that you expected from the review and the hotel website. Occasionally bad things can happen when you're staying in hotel. But to have it happened and gets ignored by Management of the hotel is irresponsibly unacceptable. For it to happen on Christmas day is an added bonus to the blow. Stay away from this hotel. We do not think the close location to metro warrants sleeping with vermins, unless they are your cup of tea. The hotel have a policy to leave keys with them upon leaving. There were at least two occasions where the front-desk staffs confidently greeted us with the wrong key when we came back to the hotel, without asking which room number we stayed in. We could not imagine what would happen if he had given our key to someone else. It's like anyone can walk into the hotel and ask for a room key. From other reviews, this sounds like normal operation at this place. You would not want to leave your valuables behind, unless you don't mind strangers ransacking your belongings upon your return. Lack of security.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: DimitraGreece
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Hotel De Suez for it's GREAT location.We were very anxious before checking in because we were 3 girls and our fear was if the location was safe or not.We found out when we arrived that the Latin Quarter is full of life.We could return to hotel late at night and we never felt any danger.Easy walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Champs Elysees,and Arc de Triompe. The room was very clean.Our room was spacy enough but maybe because we had a triple one. People at the reception were very friendly,gave us good information about metro,rer,resturants etc and spoke well English. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but there are many brasseries nearby with great croissants and very low prices. Will indeed stay at this hotel when we return to Paris in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Troubling”
Reviews.Author: MyaAsia
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was nice, but the rooms were too small. You had to climb up stairs to get to the bathroom which was narrow. When we went to ask the receptionist whether we can change rooms, he was very rude and threatened us which ended up with us checking out. Definitely not a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cherienian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in the Latin Quarter. It close to the metro that can zip you all over Paris and is close walking distance to wonderful sights such as Notre Dame, the Seine river, the Louvre, and much much more. The rooms are a nice size with a juliet balcony over looking the street. My fiance and I live in a big city so the noise level was normal for us, but if you are a country dweller who isn't used to traffic/pedestrian noise, you might want to request a room that doesn't face the street. The hotel offers a breakfast for an extra price, but we found it was more fun and maybe a little cheaper to just wander Paris until we found a cafe to have breakfast at outside nearby. There is only a small elevator that will hold 1-2 people or 1 person and a suitcase so be prepared for walking up the winding staircase to get to your room. That was ok for us though, because all the sweet crepes and pastry we were indulging in, we needed a workout! In summary: The best thing about this hotel is the location location location! The room is nice enough but nothing to take your breath away!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Winesoakedjourney
Reviews.Content: Getting off at the St.Michel station, you head south in the direction you pop out of the station. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk from the station. Overall, the Suez was a good location to stay at in Paris when looking for something affordable. For the price, the value and size of the room was adequate. We were also able to walk to a lot of the major tourist attractions. We stayed in 206, which was on the backside of St.Michel, yet still very noisy throughout the night. The bathroom was relatively spacious, although you had to walk up a set of stairs to get to it. One of the drawbacks is that there aren’t many boulangeries or grocery stores in the area, except for the Monoprix. As mentioned in other reviews, there are plenty of restaurants to eat at just a bit north of the hotel. If you’re looking for a place to eat with a set menu, DO NOT eat at Le Pre Grill, as we found better places in the area for less.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and Great location”
Reviews.Author: DJR43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel de Suez for 3 nights in early October. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was extremely clean. The location was excellent. Easy walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Champs Elysees,and Arc de Triompe. Will indeed stay at this hotel when we return to Paris in the future. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect..perfect...perfect”
Reviews.Author: blissandemptiness
Reviews.Content: Charming! I've read reviews that the room is too small and too noisy. This is Paris.....need I say more? The room was perfect, a charming little balcony and the best shower I have used in Europe for this price. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. I will only stay at this hotel when I return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Nitr0gen
Reviews.Content: It is in between 2 stations - Luxembourg for the RER B and Cluny La Sorbonne for the Metro. Luxembourg is a bit further away but is probably more convenient as this particular RER line B connects the hotel with Ciampino Airport (Budget terminal) in the south and C De Gaulle airport in the north. This hotel is along quite a busy street with many restaurants and bars and close to the Pantheon and Musee Du Moyen Age (Middle Ages) as well. For coffee addicts, there are TWO starbucks along the street (Blvd Saint Michel) on either side, but don't forget to try French coffee as well. The room was alright, not to small but some other rooms I saw looked much nicer though I suspect they are of the same category. Anyway, the staff are friendly and breakfast can be served direct to your room at no extra charge. It consists of Croissant, soft roll, coffee/tea, OJ. Being close to both Metro and RER lines allows you easy access to all the sites to see, though learning how to navigate in the twisting, turning train tunnels can be very tricky. Even the locals have some difficulty. The room I was in did not have a mini bar, safe and the TV had no cable, Internet is provided in the lobby at 2 euros for 20 mins or you can use your own laptop as well, though I don't know how they charge for that. The bathroom is clean and quite spacious for a hotel of this standard, though I found the flooring to be strange. A lot of old buildings in Europe have this kind of wooden (I think) flooring that creaks when you walk over it. Sometimes, I though it would break under my weight, and it got a bit noisy sometimes. Overall, I would probably return. This place has a good price, good service, and a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ekr06
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of the Latin Quarter, within walking distance to the Notre Dame, tons of restaurants and several metro stops. This is a nice, clean hotel with great basic amenities including free internet and a small elevator. The room we had did not have a/c but still comfortable and quiet enough to sleep with the windows open (interior room). Overall a great option for the price in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - made our 1st trip so much better”
Reviews.Author: fibermatic
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with our room and the Hotel de Suez. It was clean and the staff was very helpful. We stayed on the 4th floor in a room facing the courtyard. (I think if we had a room overlooking Blvd. St. Michel it wouldn't have been as quiet.) We were steps away from the RER/Metro Cluny-La Sorbonne station. Also nearby were cafes, a bookstore, and a Monoprix grocery store for quick snacks. Quick walk to Notre Dame, Pantheon, Cluny Museum... so great! The staff was friendly -- very helpful, spoke English, and entertained our attempts at speaking French. I had read other reviews about the rooms being small but we have a small house so the bathroom was actually bigger than ours at home! We're not super high-class people either so this room was a luxury for us. And the entrance is tiny, tucked between two stores, and we almost missed it a couple times -- look for the vertical "hotel" sign above the awning and two potted topiaries outside the doors. We had the breakfast for one day but skipped it for the rest -- not worth 7 Euro when you can get great pastries down the street and juice at Monoprix for much cheaper. But we felt very at home here and are recommending this hotel to all our friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location In Paris”
Reviews.Author: eurofoot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 10 days at the Hotel Suez this April. We have been staying there for over 40 years. This hotel just keeps getting better and better. Sandrine and her staff are friendly, knowledgeable professionals with excellent English language skills and of course complete knowledge of Paris. Even today’s prices are an excellent value. The hotel is sparkling clean. The location is in the heart of the Latin Quarter, a stone’s throw to Notre Dame and other land marks. We are planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The needle in Paris' haystack”
Reviews.Author: ack_84
Reviews.Content: After proscrastinating about which hotel to stay in while visiting Paris (too many to choose from), I took a chance and booked this hotel. It paid off - great location (right in the centre of town; close to ammenities, transport & sights), great service (staff were very friendly and spoke English well), good value, and offered exactly what we needed - cosy, clean room.

Reviews.Title: “The Suez is Great”
Reviews.Author: LilyBelle8
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with 2 friends and the Suez was a great place to stay. We shared 1 room, and it was a good size for all three of us and offered a safe in the room- we never felt crowded. The Suez is in St. Michel district, which is a fun place for young travelers. The Suez was in walking distance of most of the key attractions, but there is a metro stop very close. There are great restaurants and shopping close by as well. The staff was always very friendly and our room was clean. I unfortunately do not have pictures but we had a 2 full-bed room and it was great for the 3 of us since we were trying to budget. Great price! Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sroberts55
Reviews.Content: This place is ok. It is clean and in a convenient location but it is extremely noisy. When making the reservation we specifically asked for quiet room and were offered two "quiet" rooms. If our room was considered quiet, we hate to imagine what a noisy room is like. Our room faced St. Michel and even with the windows and shutters closed, you could still hear the street noise. We bought ear plugs for the second night but they didn't help much. Between the noise from the guest in the room next to us, the people in the stairwell and the elevator plus the traffic, it meant for two sleepless night.

Reviews.Title: “best deal”
Reviews.Author: chenbear
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Suez just after the first week of October and stayed for three weeks… the hotel was comfortable, the location excellent, and the price was right for us at $150.00 a night. Prior to arriving at Hotel Suez we had spent a week at the Hotel Zetter in London... where we were charged $500.00 a night for our room. Side by side the rooms at Hotel Suez in Paris are comparable to the rooms at the Hotel Zetter in London. The only problem we experienced with the Hotel Seuz… they offer free wifi. I had to use another service for wifi; not by choice but rather the Hotel Suez wifi was simply inadequate, and I had to pay for the other wifi service. Anyhoo, Hotel Suez is very comfy… however the street noise does reach the rooms. We are from New York City and completely in love and faithful to our city, but Paris is amazing… I have been to Paris many times over the years for extended stays… half of the rumors about the Parisians are true and the other half are not… Paris and the Parisians are good and bad and always beautiful… if I did not live in New York, Paris would be my girl.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ambar_marrero
Reviews.Content: the hotel has a great location. the room was clean. the bathroom looked like it was recently renovated and for the price it was an amazing stay. i would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but don't expect a lot...”
Reviews.Author: inlisbon
Reviews.Content: Been there for a 3 night stay.I paid 110€ for a double bed The room was small but adequate.The thing I didn't like was the lack of personality of the hotel:you could be in London or India, there was no "parisian feel" to it.The lift is really small, if you are claustrophobic don't even consider it.I asked one week before to have a room with a view to the street, when I arrived they gave me a room with a view to the inner walls of the hotel.I tried twice to change it but no way.The hotel is not service oriented:they smile and are polite, but they really don't care a lot.The worse thing is that, in case of a fire, your chances of escaping would be minimal if you stay on one of the upper floors as I did.Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in great location”
Reviews.Author: Hyperplanners
Reviews.Content: This is a great deal, in a perfect location near Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, and metro and RER stops. The front desk is always available and very helpful, and the rooms, while smallish, are clean and up-to-date. The huge windows afford great views of the street scene below, but heavy window-doors close to keep out almost all of the street noise. For a family of five, we were given connecting rooms, each at a very reasonable price, and thus had plenty of room and two bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jessandmatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. When booking this hotel through their web-site they were very polite and made it quite easy. Upon arrival they were helpful and checked us in right away. Our room was a good size and we actually had a little bit of an upstairs in our room, we had to go up a stair-case to our bathroom right inside of our room, which gave the room some deff. character. Everything was kept pretty clean except the bathroom could have used a little work.....we were left with someones dirty pair of underwear (from a previous guest) and the shower needed a scrub. The shower did not have a light above it, so shaving in the shower was a bit tough. Other than that the room was comfortable. The hotel staff was always more than helpful when we had asked them questions and always polite. The location of this hotel was wonderful and is the best part about it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de Suez simply magnificent”
Reviews.Author: evemauve
Reviews.Content: After searching practically all the hotels in paris we chose HOTEL DE SUEZ because of its location and of course because of its price. 70 euros for a double room in the middle of the touristic area is a very good deal. we were utterly satisfied by the kindeness and the excellent knowledge of english of the staff, the tideness of the rooms and of course the LOCATION!!! A bus stop just outside the hotel on st.michael boulevard and a 2 minute walk to the river Siene,the Notre Dame,the Pantheon and the nearest metro stations Clunny,and saint michael.The famous st.germain boulevard is just around the corner and if you are feeeling hungry after midnight when everything is closed there is a lovely creperie called "crepuschle" on st.germain 100 where the nicest person i've ever met i there to prepare a delicious crepe for you!!! don't forget to get a romantic boat trip on the river and check the routes of the buses in front of the hotel. one of them takes you right outside the Louvre!! there is also a little cafe on the other side of the hotel if you do no wish to have breakfast inside. the queues at the museums are enormous so prebook a museum pass to avoid them!!! it will save you a lot of time!!! i spent a wonderful time in paris and hotel DE SUEZ had alot to do with it!! I STRONGLY RECOMMEND IT TO EVERYONE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: skittles_2203
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel located smack in the middle of St-Michel and St-Germain. We only stayed 2 nights, but really enjoyed it! The bathroom/room was so clean, I could not believe it. For a 2* this is definitely worth the money. The front desk were very helpful and even though our room faced St-Michel, we did not feel that noise was an issue. I recommend this hotel for great location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: DoonanDags
Reviews.Content: After searching for days on the internet, I found good reviews for this hotel and they were spot on. It is just a 2 star hotel but value for money is 5 star. Its proximity to all the attractions of Paris and ease of travel around the city is great. The staff were lovely and very helpful and reception had staff with good English. Would recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “BEST location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: world_in_80
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget...I stayed in summer 2005 and plan on returning this fall. This hotel is perfect for a short stay in Paris. It's very central and clean. Be realistic-this is a very central location for around $100. Don't expect luxury, but you can expect a very nice and affordable stay. Maybe not the best choice for your honeymoon (stay at the George V) but perfect for any other stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie007
Reviews.Content: Expected a small room but was pleasantly surprised by the size. Toilet and shower were adequate. The room was very clean. Our room was on the fifth floor at the side of the hotel so we did not have much noise from Boulevard St. Michel. We had the added bonus of a roof-top patio with table, chairs and some plants. This hotel is in an excellent location and is great value. Having spent weeks searching for a suitable hotel, I feel that this was definitely a wise choice. Took pictures of the lift - it was so small. One adult and one suitcase was all it took but it did not bother us in the least as we tended to use the stairs. The staff were very friendly and helpful. No complaints - except that my holiday was not long enough.

Reviews.Title: “St Michel Blvd.”
Reviews.Author: jevtar
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel de Suez perfect for what I needed. An inexpensive, clean, accomadation for myself for 2 nights close to EVERYTHING in Paris. Lots and LOTS to do all within walking distance.Metro or RER very close {aprox. 1 block} Staff outstanding and yes my room faced Blvd. also, but again depends your needs. Internet downstairs in lobby and pharmacy, restaurants or what ever you need all very close.Thank You ~

Reviews.Title: “Good location but too noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraMiami
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel with good location but extremely noisy as far as traffic. Nice size room for Europe and clean but there is no AC so you either leave the door open to St. Michel Boulevard (which is a main street) and hear the noise all night long or sweat. Although it was the end of April and beginning of May it was very hot for that time of the year. I spent close to three weeks in Paris and I eventually had to change hotels to a quieter one. I would recommend it in winter time or for shorter stays or if you do not mind the noise or heat. The noise is bad, ambulances and police sirens all night, busses, people partying, etc. Otherwise, nice, clean, very basic European hotel.

Reviews.Title: “too bad location is so noisy”
Reviews.Author: 0canuck
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, good room and good front desk service. Location is excellent, close to Metro and Latin Quarter attractions; ie. Cluny Museum, Sorbonne, Pantheon etc. It is just too bad that the location is very noisy. We had a room facing a side street, just off Blvd St Michel. But the weather was warm for April and we needed the windows open for air. It was noisy at night and again early in the morning. too bad. Otherwise I'd give this hotel an unqualified recommendation in all other respects. Their room prices were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Good service”
Reviews.Author: lawlessgal
Reviews.Content: Just got back from five nights at the Hotel de Suez. Had a room right on the Boulevard. There is traffic noise if you leave your window open, but most nights we were so tired from all the walking that it didn't bother us one bit. On the rare occaision I couldn't sleep I closed the window and there was no problem. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was clean although not luxurious. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel de Suez”
Reviews.Author: MatthewM
Reviews.Content: The Staff: (5/5) - truly friendly and helpful. They gave good advice on routine questions: bus and train routes and stops, money exchange, and local food. Nice folks - very easy to deal with. The Location: (5/5) - the best part about the Hotel de Suez is the location. For monuments - you are a few minutes from the Musee de Cluny ('Moyen Age'), S. Severin, Jardin de Luxembourg, the Sorbonne, the Pantheon, and if you walk ten minutes up the street you are on the Quay across from Notre Dame Cathedral. You are surrounded by shops of Rue Saint Michel and the Latin Quarter. There are restaurants of every type and price range near. There are even three cinemas and two English-language bookstores nearby! Also very important - you are a brief walk from the RER B line train which goes to both CDGaulle and Orly airports. (not to mention the several metro lines that reach the Odeon/S Michel stop nearby). The Room: (5/5) - Let me say outright that the rooms are small. This is not an apartment. But it was big enough for a married couple with several large suitcases to unpack and live comfortably. Aside from size, there are many reasons to love the rooms: a nice bathroom, good closet space, and best of all - the gorgeous balcony (ask when you book - not all rooms have one). Room safes and mini-fridges are available on request. The bathroom was clean, with good water pressure in the shower. The Bed (4/5) - The mattress was comfortable, and the pillows and sheets cozy. No complaints, except that Paris was so interesting I couldn't enjoy the soft bed enough. The Hotel (3/5) - there is little to complain about in the hotel itself - it is average. The lobby is particularly friendly (big tv always turned to soccer or French news). You will laugh at the tiny elevator (an oversized dumb waiter!) - two people can fit inside (if they want to know each other well), and - it works. The Amenities (3/5) - no food available except drinks, snacks and breakfast from the front desk. Many fine restaurants are nearby. Within a five minute walk you can find everything from , bakeries, fruit markets, Starbucks, and crepe stands to excellent chic dining. The wifi provided to the hotel is not too expensive, and works pretty well if you're willing to move around your room for the best signal. Overall, we would highly recommend the Hotel de Suez for the comfort, the convenience, the neighborhood, and the value.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with stay”
Reviews.Author: woolly1dog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in Sept 2005 and found it a satisfactory stay. It is in the 5th arrondissment, near the Latin Quarter. The rooms were clean and one bed was a double, and another bed was a single. The window opened to a wall. The water closet with the toilet was across the room from the main bathroom which makes we wonder, does everyone remember to wash their hands afterwards?? It is walking distance to the Notre Dame, Musee d'Orsay, and Louvre. Shops and restaurants are close by as well as the transit stations. The hotel staff is cordial and they speak English. The hotel is located on a large boulevard that has no legal place in front to stop a car, so we had to park far away and on the day of departure, the taxi stopped at the street corner for us. The elevator is extremely narrow so beware if you are bringing bulky luggage. The floor we stayed on was a few steps up after using the elevator so it was a bit awkward to lug the suitcases up. The staff provided excellent restaurant choices. I called home to the US on the hotel phone without having to spend an excessive amount of money. Overall, I think the hotel was worth the price we paid to be close to restaurants and shops and the main attractions without having to spend a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia57
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here in 2003, and I would recommend it for anyone looking for a decent accomodations, at reasonable rates. The staff was very friendly, and helpful. The location is great, near to a metro station, shopping, and St. Germain area. Didn't eat at the hotel at all, so I'm not sure how that is. We had a room that was in the courtyard, not streetside; it was clean and decent, and perfect for our stay in Paris as we were barely in the room except to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Paris 100%”
Reviews.Author: Barbatul
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights in August. Hotel is small and nice: good 2 stars in the centre of Paris for a reasonable price (August is low season, so I payed around 85 euro per night). Location is perfect: just near Sorbonne, Pantheon and the intersection of St Michel and St Germain boulevards. RER Luxembourg (direct train from the CDG Airport) is only two minutes walk. Notre Dame is five minutes walk. If you go in this hotel, book one of two rooms with terraces on the upper floors. Your terrace will face a little quiet Champolion street instead of noisy St Michel boulevard. And you'll have a nice view on the Sorbonne and roofs. Every morning you'll take a breakfast with that view because the meal is served in the room (there is no restaurant in hotel: it's too small). It's very unusual and very romantic. 100% Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite in Paris”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelingBird
Reviews.Content: I hesitated to write this review, because the increasing popularity of this hotel seems to be raising the prices gradually; but all hotels in Paris are doing this, anyway, and this place deserves all of the good press that it gets! The Hotel de Suez is absolutely our favorite hotel in Paris. It has nearly everything: its location is second to none (in the heart of the 5th arrondissement); the rooms are clean and comfortable (with generous bathrooms); and the prices, considering the location and caliber of the hotel, are surprisingly affordable. We have stayed at this hotel, most likely, seven or eight times, and each stay has been lovely. We are going back next week! There are two caveats, both of them minor, in our estimation. Yes, the elevator is tiny, big enough for one person with luggage or two without. (In Paris, at these prices, you are lucky to have any elevator at all.) And the breakfast has always been a disappointment to us: like all hotel breakfasts in Paris, it is overpriced; but unlike most, it is of strikingly low quality, with weak coffee and not-particularly-fresh bread. But so what? There are wonderful cafes for breakfast just one-and-one-half blocks north (on the Place de la Sorbonne), and if one prefers sweet pastries, there is the lovely Brioche Doree' two blocks south (the Brioche Doree' being a chain bakery but still putting out product of exceptional quality -- we usually have breakfast there, as my wife loves sweet pastry). (Stay away from the overpriced and mediocre cafe at the corner of the Rue des E'coles and Rue Saint Jacques.) All of these places serve much less expensive breakfasts than the hotel, anyway, and it is nice to be out and exploring already at breakfast time. In the meantime, staying at this hotel, you will have a lovely, stately, old-style and quite comfortable room in the center of everything, for surprisingly little money. We hope that the Hotel de Suez never changes, or else we will have to do quite a bit of looking in Paris to find something comparable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous200
Reviews.Content: OK so this is not the Ritz but in terms of price and location this is a great hotel! Just a step away from all the nice restaurants in the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, the Seine and the Metro. The rooms are small but adequate, after all you dont come to Paris to sit in your hotel room.. Our room was facing the road and with the doors open was a bit noisy but couldn’t really hear the traffic once they were closed which was OK for the time of year but you would be a bit stuck in the summer as I don’t think the hotel is air conditioned! On the plus side though the rooms were clean and the shower was lovely, also the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would say the best way to see Paris is to get a two-day ticket for one of the open top bus tours, at EURO 28 it probably seems quite expensive but will take you to all the attractions with views of Paris along the way (you can pick it up at the bottom of St Michel). If money is tight then you can use the Metro, there are 2 stations within a few mins walk from the hotel but I found it to be old, very dirty, hot and cramped (and thats coming from someone who uses London Underground every day..!). Although its alot quicker than the bus if say for example you want to go to the Moulin Rouge. Overall would recommend this hotel because of the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great croissants and Coffee!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Hotel de Suez. After reading other reviews, I had to agree that there was some noise but not enough to keep us awake after a long day sight-seeing. Besides if you can't beat 'em join 'em--when in Paris why on earth would you miss out on the night life? If you want resort living this is not the place for you. If you want the flavor of true Paris this is it-- a great location, a delicious croissant, roll, and coffee that, yes, they charge for (as one reviewer complained) but where else can you get breakfast delivered to your room upon request for a few euros? Don't expect bacon and eggs--you become a guest in THEIR culture. If you want to be treated like you are at home--stay home. By the way, our bath had been up-dated even with towel warmers (tho' no tub for the spa seekers). Yes, there was no air that we could see so it may get warm in the summer but I would call and ask if there are portable units. Other reviewers called the hotel "dated" but we loved the old-world charm and our little wrought-iron balcony. In the morning we could swing open the french doors and enjoy the fresh air and sights of Rue St. Michel. Altho' I would have loved to see some Parisian-inspired fabrics on the bed and drapes, the rooms were clean and adequate for what we needed . The metro and bus stops are on the same block and countless restaurants all around. There is even a small but oh-so-fun elevator in this 110- year-old hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We would definitely stay again and hope someday soon we will.

Reviews.Title: “The Satisfactory Suez”
Reviews.Author: artml1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel (Grand) Suez on at least two previous occasions, not including this recent trip in April, 2006. Knowing the hotel, I had no greater expectations than the impression I was left with from this recent visit. The location is excellent, both to the Latin Quarter, the Seine River, Notre Dame (and other walkable scenic sites) and the Metro. The Sorbonne is just up the street as are the Luxembourg Gardens. St. Michel, the street on which the hotel is located, is a bustling, busy thoroughfare, but not overwhelmingly so. However, if you have a room facing St. Michel, traffic noise could be disturbing. I ask for a room "to the back" and though not "scenic" by any means, it will pretty much guarantee a good night's sleep. The rooms are generally small, obviously not luxurious but definitely clean. The shower hardware was ultra-modern (a change from my last trips) and a delight to shower. If you are not desirous of a fancy, magnificently appointed hotel room and view an hotel room as somewhere to sleep while you spend the day sight-seeing and enjoying spending the difference on good food, then the Hotel Suez meets all your requirements. You can have "breakfast" for an additional 5 Euros pp which consists of croissants, butter, jelly and coffee. That's about $6 pp and may seem excessive. However, it is more than adequate and does obviate the need to "go out for breakfast" which would very likely cost more. And, of course, you can always go back to your room to brush your teeth or do any other "business" of the day. The elevator, by the way, barely fits two normal sized adults. One person might get in with small luggage. Or you can put your luggage in and send the elevator to your floor and race up the stairs to catch it arriving at your level. As for the front desk personnel, I thought they could be more personable. The front desk consists of some non-French individuals who may have been slightly more forthcoming than the one French lady we encountered. However, I think that was more a personality issue than the fact we were American. Indeed, I never felt any evidence of animosity because of our nationality. I do speak some French which may help. In particular, I found the French police and Gendarmerie to be very helpful and pleasant. Yes, I would go back to the Hotel Suez because the price is reasonable, the room is appropriately priced (after all, this is PARIS!), the location is excellent and the rest is what you make of it!

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clychan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed a week at the Suez. Its location is excellent- near lots of cafes and restaurants and walking distance to Notre Dame and the Pantheon. Our room and bathroom were clean and well sized. The only thing I didn't like about the room were the hard sausage-like pillows that were provided to us. It didn't make for a comfortable night's rest. There was a bit of noise at night but this is because of the hotel's location on Boulevard st.michel. The staff were excellent. They speak English and were very helpful, especially when we fell sick and needed a doctor in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: skozub
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in March of 2004. We had a room over looking Boulevard Saint-Michel on the third floor. The hotel room was average but very comfortable. The bathroom is separate and not too small. The shower pressure was fantastic! We slept very well at night but Saturday was very noisy in the street below. French doors open to the street to allow a wonderful breeze to blow in. Perhaps the best part of this hotel is the location. Very, very close to the Latin Quarter was ideal for us. We loved the nightlife in the area and enjoyed our stay here. It's not the Ritz but it's not that expensive either. We didn't have breakfast here. I'd stay again and recommend to others.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de Suez
HotelInfo.Address: 31 Boulevard Saint-Michel | 5ème, 75005 Paris, France
